cln_elements.content:
Co(CH3COO)2·4H2O (0.80 g, 3.2 mmol) and d-(−)-quinic acid (1.2 g, 6.5 mmol) were placed in a 25 mL round-bottom flask and dissolved in 4 mL of water. The pH of the arising solution was ∼5. The reaction mixture was then stirred at room temperature until both reactants were completely dissolved. The resulting reaction mixture was placed in a Teflon-lined vessel and heated at 120 °C for 2 days. Upon returning the reaction vessel to room temperature, a pink crystalline product appeared on the bottom of the flask. The product was isolated by filtration and dried in vacuo. Yield: 1.0 g (∼71%). Anal. Calcd for 1 (C28H46Co2O25, MW: 900.51): C, 37.31; H, 5.11. Found: C, 37.50; H, 5.12%.

Transformation of [Co<sub>2</sub>(C<sub>7</sub>H<sub>11</sub>O<sub>6</sub>)<sub>4</sub>]<sub> <italic toggle="yes">n</italic> </sub>·<italic toggle="yes">n</italic>H<sub>2</sub>O to [Co(C<sub>7</sub>H<sub>11</sub>O<sub>6</sub>)<sub>2</sub>(H<sub>2</sub>O)<sub>2</sub>] ·3H<sub>2</sub>O

[Co2(C7H11O6)4] n ·nH2O (0.25 g, 0.28 mmol) was dissolved in 4 mL of water. The reaction mixture was then stirred at room temperature and placed in the refrigerator at 4 °C. Addition of ethanol resulted in the precipitation of pink crystalline material on the bottom of the flask. The crystalline product was isolated by filtration and dried in vacuo. Yield: 0.12 g (40%). Positive identification of the product was achieved by FT-IR spectroscopy and X-ray crystallographic unit cell determination for one of the single crystals isolated.

Transformation of [Co(C<sub>7</sub>H<sub>11</sub>O<sub>6</sub>)<sub>2</sub>(H<sub>2</sub>O)<sub>2</sub>]·3H<sub>2</sub>O to [Co<sub>2</sub>(C<sub>7</sub>H<sub>11</sub>O<sub>6</sub>)<sub>4</sub>]<sub> <italic toggle="yes">n</italic> </sub>·<italic toggle="yes">n</italic>H<sub>2</sub>O

[Co(C7H11O6)2(H2O)2]·3H2O (0.10 g, 0.19 mmol) was dissolved in 4 mL of water in a 25 mL round-bottom flask. The resulting mixture was then placed in a Teflon-lined vessel and heated at 120 °C for 2 days. Finally, a pink crystalline product appeared on the bottom of the vessel. The product was isolated by filtration and dried in vacuo. Yield: 0.060 g (71%). Positive identification of the product as 1 was achieved by FT-IR spectroscopy and X-ray crystallographic unit cell determination for one of the single crystals isolated.

Synthesis of [Zn<sub>3</sub>(C<sub>7</sub>H<sub>11</sub>O<sub>6</sub>)<sub>6</sub>]<sub> <italic toggle="yes">n</italic> </sub>·<italic toggle="yes">n</italic>H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>2</bold>)

The complex was prepared under hydrothermal conditions in a 23 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container by heating a mixture of Zn(CH3COO)2·2H2O (0.80 g, 3.6 mmol) and d-(−)-quinic acid (1.4 g, 7.3 mmol) in 10 mL of H2O under continuous stirring. The pH of the resulting solution was ∼5. The mixture was heated at 160 °C for 72 h. The colorless crystals were isolated by filtration and dried in vacuo. Yield: 0.70 g (42%). Anal. Calcd for 2 (C42H68O37Zn3, MW: 1361.07): C, 37.03; H, 5.00. Found: C, 37.10; H, 4.96%.

cln_elements.content: Magnetic susceptibility measurements on complex 1 were carried out at different magnetic fields and in the temperature range 3.0−290.0 K. Figure shows the χM T versus T magnetic susceptibility data at 0.5 T. The χM T values decrease from 7.2 emu mol−1 K at 290 K to 3.2 emu mol−1 K at 3.0 K. The high-temperature value of χM T is higher than 3.75 emu mol−1 K, the value that would be expected for a Co(II) dinuclear system with S 1 = S 2 = 3/2 (g = 2).
cln_elements.clean_text:
Magnetic Susceptibility

Magnetic susceptibility measurements on complex 1 were carried out at different magnetic fields and in the temperature range 3.0-290.0 K. Figure  shows the χM T versus T magnetic susceptibility data at 0.5 T. The χM T values decrease from 7.2 emu mol-1 K at 290 K to 3.2 emu mol-1 K at 3.0 K. The high-temperature value of χM T is higher than 3.75 emu mol-1 K, the value that would be expected for a Co(II) dinuclear system with S 1 = S 2 = 3/2 (g = 2).
